description: Mr. Bush, another Republican politician from Florida, complicates the choices for some donors considering whom to support in the next presidential campaign.
title: Jeb Bush Looms Large for Marco Rubio in 2016
title_page: Jeb Bush Looms Large for Marco Rubio in 2016 - The New York Times
maintext:
GREENVILLE, S.C. — Senator Marco Rubio, Republican of Florida, stood in front of reporters before a book signing here, pondering the question that has dogged him ever since Jeb Bush announced his plans to pursue a presidential bid: How does a Bush candidacy complicate Mr. Rubio’s own Oval Office aspirations, especially among donors?
“I’ve never had that question before,” Mr. Rubio said, with a laugh.
But the specter of a Bush run for the White House has shadowed Mr. Rubio’s own presidential hopes like a muggy Florida rain cloud.
The implicit question hounds him in news media headlines, follows him from event to event and has become something of a Washington parlor game: Is the already crowded Republican field for 2016 big enough for two Florida politicians?
“I’m not running against Jeb Bush if I run for president,” said Mr. Rubio, 43. “We have our own message and our own network of supporters.”
